sections.value: alpha version guide information: ritual creates an array core and four array foci
This ritual will require 4 Pedestals placed 3 blocks out from the center of the ritual- it will inform you of coordinates if theyre missing -->
The ritual will provide appropriate feedback should any of the requirements be unmet when attempting to start it.

there are two 'implemented' array arrangements which are the targetting mechanic of the array, the arrangement is determined by items placed on the ritual pedestals, each arrangement has a set of viable items that identify it

The offensive arrangement targets enemies- other players and monsters- the reagents you can use in the ritual are determined by the #offensive_arrangement tag and include tridents, diamond swords, minor motes of fire or ender or wood/stone construct blade arms

The defensive arrangement targets the caster and allies- the reagents you can use in the ritual are determined by the #defensive_arrangement tag and include scutes, shulker shells, minor motes of arcane or earth or wood/stone construct shield arms

There are currently three* array functions, each function is determined by casting a corresponding spell on one of the array focii, array functions only apply while an array is active. arrays can be activated by using a vinteum or chimerite manaweavers wand

casting a spell with break on an array focus will give the array the break prevention function. this function -while the array is active- will prevent all block breaking by other players within a 32 block radius
casting a spell with explosion on an array focus will give the array the explosion prevention function. this function -while the array is active- will prevent all explosions within a 32 block radius

casting a spell that grants a potion effect on an array focus will give the array the 'effect application' function. this function -while the array is active- will apply the chosen potion effect to entities in a 32 block radius depending on the arrangement
i claim no guarantees of stability
